Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description: It's fun to work at a company where people truly believe in what they are doing!  Job Description:  Job Description  Data Services is the team within ECA which manages and shepherds data through the entire lifecycle of a class action or similar matter, such as a mass tort claim. Each case, while unique, undergoes a similar lifecycle and series of operations, including initial gathering/scrubbing/loading of client data, notifying potential class members, receiving claim information, computing and disbursing settlement amounts, and so on. Each of these steps will be reflected by and/or have material effect on the underlying case data. The Business System Analyst (BSA) is responsible for understanding the requirements for a particular case, or step of a case, and determining how those functional requirements translate into technical specifications. The BSA translates functional requirements into a technical statement of work from which developers can code solutions. The BSA works directly with Client Services, Technical Project Managers, Data Analysts, QC Analysts, other BSAs, department Team Leads, and others to understand all aspects of the case and to determine and document the data-oriented solution.           Work is fast-paced and performed in an office environment with extensive contact with clients and employees. The industry we serve demands the highest level of confidentiality and professionalism in safeguarding client and project information. Highly effective Class Action & Claims Solutions and Corporate Services associates thrive on being in an environment that rewards the following critical success factors:    The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essentials functions.   If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Title: Senior Analyst, Risk Reporting
Description: Address  100 King Street West  Job Family Group  Data Analytics & Reporting Reporting to the Senior Manager, Structured Market Risk Reporting, this Senior Analyst, Risk Reporting role provides value-added risk measurement methodologies and systems to support Corporate Treasury in the management of structural market risk within the Bank. This role will be engaged in maintaining risk models on a regular basis in order to provide up-to-date and accurate reports on risk measures.  Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes.  Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.  Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions. Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions. Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations. Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions). Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues. Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting. Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g., visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights. Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations. Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences. Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.  Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.    Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. CPA, MBA (Finance), BA (Economics, Commerce), BSc (Math), CFA, or equivalent. Knowledgeable in Bank products and financial instruments In-depth. Risk Management In-depth.  Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, Matlab, SPSS highly desirable. Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Data driven decision making - In-depth.    At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.  As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one for yourself and our customers. Well support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, well help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.  To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .  BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each others differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Senior Analyst, Actuarial (Quebec City)
Description: Chez Intact, nous considérons que l’assurance doit d’abord s’intéresser aux personnes, et non aux choses. Cette conviction est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. C’est pourquoi nous nous efforçons d’offrir une expérience hors du commun aux clients et de créer un milieu de travail inspirant où nos employés peuvent exceller.  En tant que plus important fournisseur d’assurance de dommages au Canada, non seulement nous sommes un chef de file de l’industrie, mais nous y redéfinissons le travail. À titre d’employeur de choix, nous nous engageons à vivre nos valeurs et à soutenir nos employés, qui donnent le meilleur d’eux-mêmes chaque jour parce qu’ils savent que leur contribution est importante.  Votre poste  Nous cherchons un ou une Analyste principal(e), Actuariat pour notre équipe grandissante de Québec (5700, boul. Des Galeries).  En tant que plus important fournisseur d’assurance de dommages au Canada, une part importante de notre travail se déroule en arrière-plan. Nos équipes du secteur technologique redéfinissent nos façons de faire. Nos équipes d’indemnisation améliorent constamment la manière dont nous aidons les clients à reprendre le cours normal de leur vie après un sinistre. Nos équipes de produits mettent au point des solutions novatrices qui protègent les gens et les entreprises pour qu’ils puissent se concentrer sur ce qui compte le plus pour eux. Et toutes ces transformations découlent largement de la contribution de nos équipes d’actuariat.  Nous avons besoin de vous et de votre expertise pour trouver des solutions à des problèmes complexes que seuls des esprits critiques comme vous peuvent résoudre. Nous mettons tout en œuvre pour créer un milieu de travail inspirant qui offre de belles occasions de perfectionner vos compétences, de poursuivre une carrière enrichissante et de concrétiser vos idées novatrices.  Si vous voulez vous joindre à l’équipe d’un employeur de choix et d’un chef de file des méthodes d’apprentissage automatisé, ceci pourrait être votre chance.     Vos compétences       Énoncé fermeture    Le respect est une des valeurs d’Intact. Pour nous, cela veut dire voir la diversité comme une force, favoriser l’inclusion et encourager la collaboration. En effet, nous valorisons la diversité et tâchons de créer un milieu de travail inclusif et motivant où tous se sentent appréciés, respectés et écoutés.  Si nous pouvons faire quelque chose de particulier pour rendre le processus de recrutement plus accessible pour vous, veuillez en informer le représentant de notre équipe d’acquisition de talents qui communiquera avec vous au sujet de cet emploi et travaillera avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.    En tant qu’employeur et entreprise de services financiers cotée en bourse, il est important pour nous d’agir dans l’intérêt des clients, de nos employés et de nos actionnaires. Nous voulons qu’Intact soit un endroit formidable où travailler! C’est pourquoi nous vous demanderons aux candidats internes et externesde consentir à une vérification de vos antécédents pour que nous puissions en savoir plus sur vous. Veuillez noter qu’un bon dossier de crédit est exigé pour les postes ayant accès à des données financières ou à des fonds.    Pour les candidats internes, vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne. Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats internes potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.    Il est important que vous soyez légalement autorisé à travailler au Canada au moment où l’offre d’emploi vous est faite. On pourrait alors vous demander de fournir une preuve d’admissibilité.  Prime de recommandation  Ce rôle est admissible à une prime de recommandation. #mesRéférences3000

Title: Senior Business Analyst/B. Consultant/B. Transformation Architect
Description: Job Description  BP&M Consulting is seeking a full-time Senior Business Analyst/Business Consultant/Business Transformation Architect with strong change management knowledge and experience to assist our clients with all aspects of reviewing, analyzing, and documenting their business processes in support of continuous improvement and transformation initiatives.  The successful candidate will work closely with stakeholders and project managers to examine major business issues, analyze the current state, provide recommendations for future state options and improvements, and perform analyses as needed during the implementation.              BP&M Consulting offers employee development and training on cutting edge business practices and a competitive compensation package and benefits, including a group insurance plan.  BP&M Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities - accommodations are available upon request.  BP&M thanks all applicants for their interest however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.    BP&M is a consulting service corporation, composed of highly experienced managers and engineers, specialized in strategic and operational optimization of the Canadian Federal-Provincial-Municipal government, para-public, manufacturing, commercial and services firms.  Our Success approach is based on the Lean Six Sigma Continuous Improvement, Agile-Scrum principles and on the best strategic ITIL, Togaf, IT4IT, operational business, management and production practices. Durable Continuous Improvement is the foundation of our Performance services.  Our objective is to position our clients in front of the competition and to ensure that you stay there! Our strategy is to maximise the value of your personnel, thus giving you the full autonomy of your Continuous Improvement management and to attain a higher level of DURABLE strategic optimization.  Our team of experienced consultants is at the origin, over thirty years ago, of the first Toyota way implementations in Canada.  We offer our clients an optimal impartial tailor made accompaniment. This service offering is done by the juxtaposition of the client's implication, the excellence of our consultants, our diagnostics, our trainings, our strategic and operational approach, our implementation methodology, our audits and an integrated implication of the best specialized partners on the market.

Title: Analyste d’affaires senior, Intégration et Service de données - Montreal
Description: Analyste d’affaires senior, Intégration et Service de données  Dans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d’un Analyste d’affaires senior, Intégration et Service de données pour une entreprise dans le domaine financier. Notre client est situé à Montréal.    L’analyste d’affaires participera à la récupération et l’analyse des besoins des clients, l’accompagnement des équipes de développement, la modélisation des données, l’accompagnement du client dans sa sélection des solutions BI et à la conception de solutions arrimées aux orientations de l’architecture d’entreprise.  Il (elle) devra aussi apporter un soutien aux équipes de développement dans un contexte de livraison agile. Il (elle) doit s’assurer que les besoins des clients sont clairement définis et réalisables par l’équipe de développement. Il (elle) se joindra à une équipe qui a comme objectif de répondre aux besoins de données de l’organisation à travers plusieurs produits. Le centre de la donnée dans le cloud (Data hub), les solutions d’historisation de la donnée dans le Cloud (Vault) et ses solutions analytiques, en plus du BUS d’entreprise évènementiel lié à un magasin de données opérationnel (ODS), le datawarehouse, le datalake, les solutions BI ainsi que toutes les composantes d’intégration entre les différents systèmes informationnels. Il (elle) devra être familier avec les technologies cloud, les outils d’analytiques avancées, les processus agiles ainsi que le domaine de l’investissement privé et public.                  Contractuel 12 mois avec possibilités de renouvellement   Immédiatement   BH298569

Title: Conseiller principale en évaluation des affaires / Senior Advisor Business Analyst - Sept-Iles
Description: Conseiller principal en évaluation des affaires Joignez-vous à notre entreprise internationale de premier plan, qui offre de formidables occasions de croissance personnelle et de développement de carrière à l’échelle mondiale      Nous sommes à la recherche d’un pour aider les diverses équipes de l’entreprise à améliorer la valeur opérationnelle grâce à l’amélioration de l’exploitation et des coûts, à l’excellence commerciale et à la gestion du risque. Le conseiller principal aidera l’entreprise à s’orienter en matière de dépenses d’immobilisation et de politiques et jouera un rôle-conseil auprès de la direction et de l’équipe de direction en effectuant les principales analyses financières afin de résoudre les problèmes complexes et de prendre les décisions de gestion.  Ce poste est une formidable occasion de jouer un rôle d’influence étant appelé à utiliser ses compétences clés en matière d’analyse financière pour procéder à des évaluations économiques, examiner des propositions d’investissements de capitaux et appuyer l’élaboration et la livraison de la stratégie d’entreprise et des plans opérationnels.  Notre équipe mondiale ouverte et connectée regroupe certains des plus brillants éléments de l’industrie. Nous vous offrons une rémunération compétitive axée sur la performance et une vaste gamme d’avantages sociaux en contrepartie de vos contributions. Grâce à notre portée mondiale, nous proposons des occasions de développement et de croissance variées et stimulantes.          À l’origine de chaque idée, de chaque innovation, de chaque petite chose qu’on appelle « progrès », il y a une personne : un explorateur, un inventeur, un entrepreneur. Un pionnier.  Depuis près de 150 ans, Rio Tinto est une entreprise de pionniers - des générations d’employés audacieux partout dans le monde qui ont en commun la vision de produire des matières essentielles au progrès humain.  Notre minerai de fer façonne la silhouette des villes, de Shanghai à Sydney. Notre aluminium - premier métal certifié « responsable » au monde - allège les avions et les voitures. Notre cuivre aide les éoliennes à produire de l’énergie. Notre bore contribue à nourrir le monde et permet d’explorer l’univers. Nos diamants célèbrent les plus beaux moments de la vie.    Le titulaire du poste sera amené à travailler à Sept-Îles.  La compagnie minière Iron Ore Company of Canada (IOC) est un chef de file canadien au chapitre de la production de concentrés et de boulettes de minerai de fer qui répondent aux besoins des clients partout dans le monde. IOC exploite une mine, une usine de concentration et une usine de boulettage à Labrador City, à Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador, en plus d’installations portuaires situées à Sept-Îles, au Québec. Elle exploite également une voie ferrée de 418 kilomètres qui relie la mine au port.    Nous sommes déterminés à créer un milieu inclusif où les employés se sentent à l’aise d’être eux-mêmes. Nous souhaitons de plus que chacun ait l’impression que sa voix compte, que toutes les cultures sont respectées et que les points de vue, aussi variés soient-ils, sont non seulement bienvenus, mais également essentiels à notre succès. Nous nous traitons mutuellement avec équité et dignité, sans égard à la race, au genre, à la nationalité, à l’origine ethnique, à la religion, à l’âge, à l’orientation sexuelle ou à tout autre aspect distinctif.  Chez Rio Tinto, nous accueillons favorablement et encourageons les candidatures d’Autochtones, de femmes, de membres de la communauté LGBTQ2S+, de travailleurs âgés, de personnes handicapées et de représentants d’origines diverses.         We are looking for a to support business teams aiming at improving business value through operation and cost improvement, commercial excellence, and risk management. The senior advisor will guide the business on capital expenditure and policies and advise management and executive team in providing key financial analysis to resolve complex issues and management decisions.  This role is a great opportunity for an adaptable and resourceful advisor to utilise his/her financial analytical skills to complete economic evaluation, review capital investment proposals, and support the development and delivery of business strategy and operations plans. This role is broad in scope involving in the entire operations from mine to port and support functions with a strong focus on value enhancement and risk mitigation.  We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industry’s best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.  Reporting to the Manager Business Evaluation and Planning and working in a exciting environment, you will:  On the other hand, this role is accountable for capital management system. You will:           Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.  For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers - generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.  Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium - the world’s first to be certified “responsible” - helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.    The Iron Ore Company of Canada (IOC) is a leading Canadian producer of iron ore concentrate and iron ore pellets serving customers worldwide. IOC operates a mine, a concentrator and a pelletizing plant in Labrador City, Newfoundland and Labrador, and port facilities in Sept-Îles, Quebec. It also operates a 418-kilometre railway connecting the mine to the port.  The position is based in Sept-Îles, an open, busy, family-oriented community with many amenities nearby. Whether you love sports, community events or beautiful hiking trails, or you just want to live near the sea, this city has something for everyone.    We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome - they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.  At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.

Title: Business Analyst (Program Admin Officer 3)
Description: Competition # : 27691  Department: Health and Wellness  Location: HALIFAX  Term  NSGEU - NSPG  11/26/2020    The Department of Health and Wellness offers opportunities to grow and advance in a dynamic sector that touches the lives of all Nova Scotians. Along with our partners, including the Nova Scotia Health Authority and the IWK Health Centre, we’re committed to continually improving our health care system. With a focus on collaborative primary health care, continuing care, improved supports for mental health and addictions, digital health, capital infrastructure, and more, the department is thinking differently about how to plan, fund, legislate and monitor to improve access and service delivery. To do this, we need leaders at all levels of the organization who embrace a challenge and believe in their ability to make a difference.  The System Innovation team works with the Chief Design Officer to conceptualize and deliver on strategic projects impacting Nova Scotia’s health care system. We are a small, dynamic team with a complementary mix of backgrounds. Working closely with our health services delivery partners and across government, we aim to develop innovative frameworks, policy, processes and tools that enable collaborative, multi-year health system planning that improves Nova Scotia’s health outcomes and optimizes value for investment. Our work is complex, involves many stakeholders and partners and is meaningful to Nova Scotians.    Are you enthusiastic about evidence-based decision making? Are you looking for a collaborative, interactive role that uses data patterns and trends to improve service and program delivery? If so, we have the job for you!  As a small focused team dedicated to tackling the big, long-term issues facing our health care system, we are looking for a Business Analyst to support our strategic, evidence-based health system planning.. Reporting to the Director, System Innovation, you will work closely with program areas such as Continuing Care and Primary Health Care to assess and collate operational datasets to support big picture shifts in health care service delivery that improve health outcomes and services for Nova Scotians. You’ll also be very involved in the application of those data sets to collaborative and strategic health system planning activities.    Within this role, you can expect to:     As the successful candidate, you will have an undergraduate degree in a field related to data analysis, planning, or policy development, and 5 years of related experience.     You are highly self-motivated, proficient using Microsoft Office programs (Word, Outlook, Power Point), and have strong interpersonal, communication (written and verbal), and organizational skills with attention to detail and accuracy while balancing priorities.  Knowledge of and experience working with the healthcare system is considered an asset.  We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.    An equivalent combination of training, education and experience will be considered. Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.    Based on the employment status and Union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.       Please note, this is a term position with an expected end date of September 17, 2021. The appointment status (‘term’, ‘temporary’ or ‘casual’) is dependent on the start date of the successful candidate. Title: Analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement / Supply Chain Analyst - Montreal
Description: Job Description  English will follow*  Altitude Sports est le plus grand détaillant canadien spécialisé dans la vente en ligne de vêtements techniques haut de gamme. Outre le site Web principal, l’entreprise possède aussi LaDerniereChasse.com, le seul site entièrement dédié à la vente à rabais de vêtements de plein air au Canada. Nous sommes en plein essor sur le marché canadien et notre équipe s'agrandit.    Relevant du directeur des opérations, l'analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement sera chargé de soutenir le déploiement de l'ambitieuse stratégie de chaîne d'approvisionnement locale et mondiale d'Altitude Sports tout en repoussant les frontières du commerce électronique. Le rôle consistera à gérer les mandats qui touchent à tous les aspects des opérations et de la logistique.  L'analyste sera responsable de l'analyse technique et opérationnelle de la logistique sortante, entrante et des retours et cherchera toujours un équilibre entre l'optimisation de l'expérience client et la maximisation de la rentabilité. Il joue également un rôle central dans la planification et le déploiement du futur centre de distribution. Le candidat idéal aura une vision étendue des processus opérationnels d'e-commerce et mettra à profit son expertise pour trouver des solutions à des problèmes et opportunités d'affaires complexes.  Le rôle principal de l'analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement est de transformer les données en informations qui génèrent de la valeur commerciale. Grâce à l'utilisation des techniques et technologies d'analyse des données, de visualisation des données et de modélisation des données, l'analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement identifie les tendances qui peuvent aider les départements, les équipes de produits, les gestionnaires et les dirigeants à prendre des décisions commerciales pour moderniser et améliorer les processus.                  Reporting to the director of operations, the Supply Chain Analyst will be responsible for supporting the rollout of the ambitious Altitude Sports local and global supply chain strategy while pushing the frontiers of e-commerce possibilities. The role will be handling mandates that touch on all aspects of operations and logistics.  The SCM analyst will be responsible for driving technical and operational analysis across outbound, inbound and reverse transportation journeys and will always strike a balance between optimizing customer experience and maximizing cost-efficiency. He/she will also play a pivotal role in scoping and rolling out the fulfilment center of the future. The ideal candidate will have a broad vision of ecomm operations processes and leverage his expertise to come up with solutions to complex business problems and opportunities.  The main role of the Supply Chain Analyst is to transform data into insights that drive business value. Through use of data analytics, data visualization and data modeling techniques and technologies, the Supply Chain Analyst identifies trends that can help departments, product squads, managers and executives make business decisions to modernize and improve processes.                Logistics,Supply chain,transportation, parcel shipping, inventory management, order management, demand and supply planning, S&OP, facility planning, network optimization, inventory optimization, warehouse operations and e-commerce fulfillment

Title: Analystes fonctionnels données - Montreal
Description: Job Description  Reelcruit est présentement à la recherche de deux (2) Analystes fonctionnels données pour un mandat  d’approximativement 12 mois.  Lieu : Montréal  Date de début : Dès que possible  Durée du mandat : 12 Mois, avec possibilité de permanence chez le client selon votre intérêt    *** Notre client aimerait pouvoir faire une offre d'emploi au terme de ce mandat.***  À titre d'analyste fonctionnel - fondations données, vous contribuez à l’efficacité informatique. Vous concevez, configurez,  administrez, maintenez et faites évoluer les réseaux informatiques, les systèmes de gestion et les serveurs des bases de  données pour répondre aux besoins de l’organisation.  Votre rôle consiste à contribuer activement au développement de systèmes, programmes et applications informatiques de  grandes envergures en réalisant l’arrimage et la mise en œuvre, tout en mettant à profit votre compétence à maîtriser la  technologie et d’anticiper les innovations. Vous analysez les besoins des clients et partenaires et recommandez les  solutions technologiques appropriées ou les systèmes d’information requis à l’intérieur d’un projet. À cet égard, vous  planifier, hiérarchisez et coordonner le travail afin de tenir les engagements pris en phase avec les objectifs à atteindre.  La nature des dossiers et des projets exige des connaissances étendues et approfondies dans votre domaine.  Vous contribuez à la résolution de problèmes comportant un niveau élevé de complexité, nécessitant une analyse et une  compréhension globale et détaillée du domaine d’affaires et de l’organisation. Les arrimages sont nombreux. Vous êtes  appelé à interagir avec un grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés.  Vous exercez un rôle de leadership et agissez à titre de spécialiste relativement aux systèmes auprès de votre unité, des  clients et divers intervenants.  Plus précisément, vous travaillez au sein d’une équipe dédiée à concevoir et livrer les solutions du domaine de gestion  des données maîtres et de données de référence (Master & Reference Data Management MDM/RDM) pour les secteurs  d’affaires de l’organisation.  Vous avez pour rôle de proposer les solutions intégrées répondant aux besoins d’affaires et conformes à l’architecture de  solution proposée par les architectes. Vous travaillez avec les équipes d’affaires et de TI diversifiées et proposez et à  défendre les solutions innovantes et modernes pour aider l’organisation à accélérer la numérisation des affaires. Vous  travaillez dans une dynamique « agile at scale », suivant la méthodologie SAFE.      etc.    les utilisateurs sur l'informatisation des opérations, le développement d'outils de gestion et d'analyse et le pilotage  des systèmes          atout)    QualityStage) (un atout)      Analystes fonctionnels données

Title: Project Manager /Business Analyst - Quebec
Description: Job Description  Job title: Project Manager/Business Analyst  Job type: Full-time, Permanent  Location: Remote (Montreal or Toronto)  About the client: Our client located in Montreal is a global Healthcare Analytics and Education Management company and is dedicated to putting information at the service of medicine. Their primary purpose is to help clients increase the effectiveness of activities pertaining to scientific communication, medical education and product/service marketing.  Position summary: Looking for a Project Manager or a Business Analyst who will be involved in managing multiple projects from inception to completion. The position involves interfacing with different business units, setting and maintaining expectations and good relationships. An ability to understand both the business domains and the technology stack is a major driving factor to success in this role.

Title: Senior Business Analyst/B. Consultant/B. Transformation Architect
Description: BP&M Consulting is seeking a full-time Senior Business Analyst/Business Consultant/Business Transformation Architect with strong change management knowledge and experience to assist our clients with all aspects of reviewing, analyzing, and documenting their business processes in support of continuous improvement and transformation initiatives.  The successful candidate will work closely with stakeholders and project managers to examine major business issues, analyze the current state, provide recommendations for future state options and improvements, and perform analyses as needed during the implementation.              BP&M Consulting offers employee development and training on cutting edge business practices and a competitive compensation package and benefits, including a group insurance plan.  BP&M Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities - accommodations are available upon request.  BP&M thanks all applicants for their interest however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.  BP&M is a consulting service corporation, composed of highly experienced managers and engineers, specialized in strategic and operational optimization of the Canadian Federal-Provincial-Municipal government, para-public, manufacturing, commercial and services firms.  Our Success approach is based on the Lean Six Sigma Continuous Improvement, Agile-Scrum principles and on the best strategic ITIL, Togaf, IT4IT, operational business, management and production practices. Durable Continuous Improvement is the foundation of our Performance services.  Our objective is to position our clients in front of the competition and to ensure that you stay there! Our strategy is to maximise the value of your personnel, thus giving you the full autonomy of your Continuous Improvement management and to attain a higher level of DURABLE strategic optimization.  Our team of experienced consultants is at the origin, over thirty years ago, of the first Toyota way implementations in Canada.  We offer our clients an optimal impartial tailor made accompaniment. This service offering is done by the juxtaposition of the client's implication, the excellence of our consultants, our diagnostics, our trainings, our strategic and operational approach, our implementation methodology, our audits and an integrated implication of the best specialized partners on the market.

Title: Market Analyst
Description: Job Category  Data Solutions, Marketing and Communications Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!  Altus Group is looking for a new Bilingual French Market Analyst to join our Ottawa office. The Market Analyst will report to the Manager, Altus Data Solutions, and be a member of a highly motivated, multi-disciplinary team of real estate professionals responsible for the production of RealNet, while adhering to Altus Data Solutions standards of excellence. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Title: Senior Analyst – Reporting
Description: Colleagues you’ll love. A dynamic and collaborative workplace where you can contribute to our story. An access to over 6,000 free courses for your continuous development and career growth. Comprehensive benefits from day one.  This is the #YPLife and what working at YP is all about.    The Senior Analyst - Reporting will be responsible for producing and enhancing company’s sales reporting and providing analytical services to the Sales, Marketing, and Finance departments.  The Candidate will need to become a subject matter expert in company’s Sales and Operations data; must be very comfortable extracting the data using SQL, must have critical thinking and be able to draw conclusions from the data. He/she will also have ability to communicate with internal clients and other groups in order to support with inquiries, investigations and special projects                You are ready to join the Yellow Pages adventure as a Senior Analyst - Reporting? Send us your resume right now!    We’ve been in the game since 1908 and we continue to transform to offer our 229 000 clients the best possible products and services. We foster business relationships between Canadian small-to-medium businesses and their prospective customers. We do this by providing tailored, locally-relevant digital media and marketing solutions designed with both in mind. Over 73% of our revenue is generated by digital solutions.

Title: Senior Analyst, Allocations (12 month contract)
Description: Location: 1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5 The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.    The Senior Analyst, Allocations is responsible to support the review process on projected forecasts for all promotional and special programs. They will assist in determining the correct amount of inventory is allocated to stores based on store specific sales history, and seasonality impacts. The Senior Analyst, Allocations will provide the analytics to support the gap in projections between category and allocations while ensuring that both sales are maximized and inventory is minimized.          At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.  If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.  In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.    Full time    Temporary with Benefits (Fixed Term)    Fixed Term Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.

Title: Business Analyst - Installation
Description: Build a meaningful career  At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 6,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Morneau Shepell is a proud Canadian owned and operated company with global ambitions with teams and over 24,000 clients all across North America, the Caribbean and the Middle East. We are the leading provider of technology-enabled HR services that deliver an integrated approach to well-being through our cloud-based platform. Well-being is our moto. One of our goals is to positively impact 1,000,000 people by 2025. We’re well on our way to surpass this goal, but we need you for the last stretch – currently we’ve impacted over 750,000 lives globally!  The Ariel EAS team at Morneau Shepell is a dynamic team of over 200 talented and motivated professionals who work collaboratively to develop, implement and support a best-in-class pension and benefits management software product serving predominately public sector clients. The Ariel EAS team is key to furthering Morneau Shepell’s mission and strategic goals.  Our solution is unique because of the diversity, drive and creativity of each team member. Our work is a mix of product development and consulting – we work closely with clients to understand their needs to implement the right product for them! You will work with talented and passionate professionals who range from Business Analysts, Developers, QA Specialists, Project Managers, Solution Designers and Product Owners.  But brace yourself, we’re not a traditional shop – in the past couple of years we’ve embarked on an Agile transformation; changing how we think about work, how we treat work, how we do the work and how we make decisions. Transformations tend to be a work-in-progress that progress through passion, try-and-error and persistence. Ours is no different. So you’re in the right place if you consider yourself a change agent or someone who likes to rock the boat in a meaningful way. Join us - be part of the family that will make a difference! Title: Conseiller principale en évaluation des affaires / Senior Advisor Business Analyst
Description: Conseiller principal en évaluation des affaires Joignez-vous à notre entreprise internationale de premier plan, qui offre de formidables occasions de croissance personnelle et de développement de carrière à l’échelle mondiale      Nous sommes à la recherche d’un pour aider les diverses équipes de l’entreprise à améliorer la valeur opérationnelle grâce à l’amélioration de l’exploitation et des coûts, à l’excellence commerciale et à la gestion du risque. Le conseiller principal aidera l’entreprise à s’orienter en matière de dépenses d’immobilisation et de politiques et jouera un rôle-conseil auprès de la direction et de l’équipe de direction en effectuant les principales analyses financières afin de résoudre les problèmes complexes et de prendre les décisions de gestion.  Ce poste est une formidable occasion de jouer un rôle d’influence étant appelé à utiliser ses compétences clés en matière d’analyse financière pour procéder à des évaluations économiques, examiner des propositions d’investissements de capitaux et appuyer l’élaboration et la livraison de la stratégie d’entreprise et des plans opérationnels.  Notre équipe mondiale ouverte et connectée regroupe certains des plus brillants éléments de l’industrie. Nous vous offrons une rémunération compétitive axée sur la performance et une vaste gamme d’avantages sociaux en contrepartie de vos contributions. Grâce à notre portée mondiale, nous proposons des occasions de développement et de croissance variées et stimulantes.  Relevant du Directeur – Évaluation et planification des affaires et travaillant dans un environnement stimulant et intéressant, vous aurez les tâches suivantes        À l’origine de chaque idée, de chaque innovation, de chaque petite chose qu’on appelle « progrès », il y a une personne un explorateur, un inventeur, un entrepreneur. Un pionnier.  Depuis près de 150 ans, Rio Tinto est une entreprise de pionniers – des générations d’employés audacieux partout dans le monde qui ont en commun la vision de produire des matières essentielles au progrès humain.  Notre minerai de fer façonne la silhouette des villes, de Shanghai à Sydney. Notre aluminium – premier métal certifié « responsable » au monde – allège les avions et les voitures. Notre cuivre aide les éoliennes à produire de l’énergie. Notre bore contribue à nourrir le monde et permet d’explorer l’univers. Nos diamants célèbrent les plus beaux moments de la vie.    Le titulaire du poste sera amené à travailler à Sept-Îles.  La compagnie minière Iron Ore Company of Canada (IOC) est un chef de file canadien au chapitre de la production de concentrés et de boulettes de minerai de fer qui répondent aux besoins des clients partout dans le monde. IOC exploite une mine, une usine de concentration et une usine de boulettage à Labrador City, à Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador, en plus d’installations portuaires situées à Sept-Îles, au Québec. Elle exploite également une voie ferrée de 418 kilomètres qui relie la mine au port.    Nous sommes déterminés à créer un milieu inclusif où les employés se sentent à l’aise d’être eux-mêmes. Nous souhaitons de plus que chacun ait l’impression que sa voix compte, que toutes les cultures sont respectées et que les points de vue, aussi variés soient-ils, sont non seulement bienvenus, mais également essentiels à notre succès. Nous nous traitons mutuellement avec équité et dignité, sans égard à la race, au genre, à la nationalité, à l’origine ethnique, à la religion, à l’âge, à l’orientation sexuelle ou à tout autre aspect distinctif.  Chez Rio Tinto, nous accueillons favorablement et encourageons les candidatures d’Autochtones, de femmes, de membres de la communauté LGBTQ2S+, de travailleurs âgés, de personnes handicapées et de représentants d’origines diverses.         We are looking for a to support business teams aiming at improving business value through operation and cost improvement, commercial excellence, and risk management. The senior advisor will guide the business on capital expenditure and policies and advise management and executive team in providing key financial analysis to resolve complex issues and management decisions.  This role is a great opportunity for an adaptable and resourceful advisor to utilise his/her financial analytical skills to complete economic evaluation, review capital investment proposals, and support the development and delivery of business strategy and operations plans. This role is broad in scope involving in the entire operations from mine to port and support functions with a strong focus on value enhancement and risk mitigation.  We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industry’s best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.  Reporting to the Manager Business Evaluation and Planning and working in a exciting environment, you will  On the other hand, this role is accountable for capital management system. You will           Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.  For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.  Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.    The Iron Ore Company of Canada (IOC) is a leading Canadian producer of iron ore concentrate and iron ore pellets serving customers worldwide. IOC operates a mine, a concentrator and a pelletizing plant in Labrador City, Newfoundland and Labrador, and port facilities in Sept-Îles, Quebec. It also operates a 418-kilometre railway connecting the mine to the port.  The position is based in Sept-Îles, an open, busy, family-oriented community with many amenities nearby. Whether you love sports, community events or beautiful hiking trails, or you just want to live near the sea, this city has something for everyone.    We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.  At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.

Title: Analyst, Product Information
Description: Description  The PI Analyst is responsible for setting up new stock and special-order items within the Product Content Management (PCM) system. This includes ensuring that all facets of data synchronization are completed, both data in the Global Data Synchronization Network (GDSN) as well as Marketing related data. The analyst will coordinate work with third parties including vendors both domestic and international and will also be responsible for coordinating and tracking the facilitation and implementation of business processes involving product data collection that impacts Merchandising, internal departments and vendors. The analyst will coordinate the identification and collection of product data that relates to product information collection and its use within Lowe’s.  In addition, this role may have responsibility to coordinate and track the facilitation and implementation of training and communication processes and documents that impact Merchandising, internal departments, teams and vendors. This may include ensuring all downstream users receive accurate process explanations and managing multiple deadlines    Serve as primary support and liaison for Merchandising, vendors and other third parties around all aspects of the items set-up process (including GDSN data collection, marketing data collection process and the PCM system) Maintain constant vendor contact to ensure that item set-up deadlines are met Review and release product data while ensuring accuracy and completeness Work closely with Merchandising management, this may include contributing product related updates at the weekly management meetings and product line reviews. Collaborate with marketing, merchandising and the online teams to keep abreast of deadlines and updates; partner with vendors to collect data within defined timeframes. Maintain documentation for internal and external customers Follow procedural guidelines for the Lowes system, the MDS and the marketing data collection process. Analyze production related reporting and identify process improvement opportunities. Trouble shoot and resolve vendor issues as it relates to the item set up and data collection process.    Oral and written bilingualism College diploma (Information Technology, Business Management or Marketing); University degree is preferred. 2+ years of vendor management experience, with a solid understanding of promotions, marketing & merchandising in a retail environment. 3+ years of total professional experience Excellent analytical skills; ability to glean insights from data and define appropriate next steps A creative and motivated problem solver. Ability to work across all levels and all areas of the company. Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously Relationship building skills Excellent time management/organizational skills Strong knowledge of Excel, Word, and Access    Work conditions :

Title: Data Entry & Analysis Clerk
Description: The Armour Group Limited is one of the leading construction and development companies in Atlantic Canada. With its dedicated team of professionals, The Armour Group Limited continues a proud history of creating a sense of place in Nova Scotia - carefully designing, developing, constructing and operating some of our region's most iconic buildings. With more than 45 years of history in our region, this family owned firm remains committed to a principled approach to development, ensuring that our buildings are environmentally sustainable and integrated into the communities they serve. If you share our values and would like to work with a skilled professional team, Armour is presently seeking a to join our growing team at our downtown Halifax location.  The Data Entry & Analysis Clerk will work with a team of motivated individuals, and will bring exceptional organizational skills to support this team. Day to day duties will include data entry, preparing reports, filing, and managing correspondence. You will compile information and develop reports; performing data entry in and pulling reports from systems such as Yardi. The successful candidate will provide occasional coverage for our Receptionist as well as other general office and administrative duties.  As the ideal candidate you will have 2 - 3 years' experience in a professional setting supporting the needs of several departments. Your experience is complemented by excellent communication and customer service skills. You exercise a high level of accuracy, efficiency and accountability in your work. You have the ability to work independently while anticipating the needs of team members with timely following through on tasks. Advanced skills in the Microsoft Office Suite is considered an asset.  In this role you will be supported in your learning and growth. You will have the opportunity to be an important member of a strong and dynamic team and be exposed to diverse business issues.  The Armour Group Limited is a family business valuing a commitment to excellence, high performance, accountability, integrity, and teamwork. We are looking for diligent people to join our team who share our values, work ethic and passion for building community.  We offer RRSP's, extended health benefits and a bonus potential. Please submit your resume and cover letter in confidence to . Include your anticipated compensation in your cover letter. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  The Armour Group Limited is an equal opportunity employer.

French is required  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  Regular Full Time Parks, Recreation, Culture and Facilities One of BC’s Top Employers, the City of Coquitlam is the sixth largest city in B.C. with home to more than 150,000 residents. Our municipality continues to grow through development of our green spaces, arts & culture, urban design and state-of-the art transportation systems. Our brand is built on managing our resources in a responsible and sustainable manner while supporting a vibrant, growing regional urban centre.  We are currently recruiting for a talented and visionary Business Analyst (BA) to join our Parks, Recreation, Culture and Facilities team where the initial focus will be to support our new parks and recreation management software, PerfectMind. The successful candidate will act as a liaison with the software vendor; track and follow up on support and enhancement requests, and product deficiencies. This position will lead the review of software new releases; analyze new features for suitability and fit and make recommendations as well as develop and coordinate regression testing; and support upgrades and staff training.    Reporting to the Business Services Manager, the successful incumbent will be the liaison between the business unit and the Information Communications Technology (ICT) division and will work closely with internal stakeholders to ensure needs are being met, and identify efficiencies that can be achieved through the use of technology and best practices as it relates to business processes. This role will bring proven experience in gathering and analyzing data, collecting and creating business requirement documents and translating business requirements into technical specifications and configuration requirements that cross multiple functional areas. The successful incumbent must possess excellent communication skills, written and verbal; have the ability to write business-appropriate correspondence and make presentations as appropriate; have the ability to use software programs for effective project management tracking and reporting. Additionally, they will have a collaborative approach in working with internal and external stakeholders that fosters and promotes teamwork.  The successful incumbent will have 5+ years of progressive experience in the field of project management/business analysis as well as possessing a Bachelor’s degree and/or applicable experience in the field of information technology; Public Administration, Commerce or Business Administration. A driver’s license for the Province of BC or equivalent is required. Proficient use and understanding of the parks and recreation management software PerfectMind would be considered an asset.  A CUPE hourly rate of $43.90 to $51.87 and also offers a competitive benefits package and an earned day off program. Applicants under consideration will be required to consent to a Police Information Check and provide an acceptable driver’s abstract.  Proficient use and understanding of the software, PerfectMind, would be considered an asset.  Please apply online by at .

Title: Analyst, Product Information
Description: The PI Analyst is responsible for setting up new stock and special-order items within the Product Content Management (PCM) system. This includes ensuring that all facets of data synchronization are completed, both data in the Global Data Synchronization Network (GDSN) as well as Marketing related data. The analyst will coordinate work with third parties including vendors both domestic and international and will also be responsible for coordinating and tracking the facilitation and implementation of business processes involving product data collection that impacts Merchandising, internal departments and vendors. The analyst will coordinate the identification and collection of product data that relates to product information collection and its use within Lowe’s.  In addition, this role may have responsibility to coordinate and track the facilitation and implementation of training and communication processes and documents that impact Merchandising, internal departments, teams and vendors. This may include ensuring all downstream users receive accurate process explanations and managing multiple deadlines    Serve as primary support and liaison for Merchandising, vendors and other third parties around all aspects of the items set-up process (including GDSN data collection, marketing data collection process and the PCM system) Maintain constant vendor contact to ensure that item set-up deadlines are met Review and release product data while ensuring accuracy and completeness Work closely with Merchandising management, this may include contributing product related updates at the weekly management meetings and product line reviews. Collaborate with marketing, merchandising and the online teams to keep abreast of deadlines and updates; partner with vendors to collect data within defined timeframes. Maintain documentation for internal and external customers Follow procedural guidelines for the Lowes system, the MDS and the marketing data collection process. Analyze production related reporting and identify process improvement opportunities. Trouble shoot and resolve vendor issues as it relates to the item set up and data collection process.  Job Requirements  Oral and written bilingualism College diploma (Information Technology, Business Management or Marketing); University degree is preferred. 2+ years of vendor management experience, with a solid understanding of promotions, marketing & merchandising in a retail environment. 3+ years of total professional experience Excellent analytical skills; ability to glean insights from data and define appropriate next steps A creative and motivated problem solver. Ability to work across all levels and all areas of the company. Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously Relationship building skills Excellent time management/organizational skills Strong knowledge of Excel, Word, and Access

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description: WE ARE A TRANSFORMATIONAL PARTNER  We marry design and engineering language in ways that produce impactful and memorable experience journeys. We partner all the way to continuously improve our clients’ digital maturity. Our Studio network brings the optimal combination of skill, scale, and cost for each stage of the product development lifecycle. And to do this we need great transformational people that want to impact the projects and organizations that they work with.    We are looking for an exceptional to work with our cross-functional team, and join our world-class community of talented experts.   We are a thriving Community of top technology talent that is globally connected. We Engage, Make, Run and Evolve the technology that makes many brands that you know and love. So let’s take this journey together. No matter where you are on your digital career roadmap, we can help you grow and have fun doing it.

Title: Senior Analyst, Project Accountant
Description: Our client is rapidly growing and carries out major projects on an international level. If you are looking for challenges in a dynamic environment that will allow you to learn, this position is for you!  Member of the Project Development team, the senior analyst is responsible for providing support to implement project cost management systems, generate and analyze cost reports for the various projects of the group.    To be discussed. Location: South-shore  Support the “Oracle – Project Accounting” application  In collaboration with the project cost control team, generate reports and analyzes on the designated projects of the Project Development group.  Assist the Director – Administration and Finance Development Projects

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: The SPUD.CA family of companies is an online grocery delivery business with integrated operations through our Be Fresh and Blush Lane markets in Western Canada. We are a passionate team of nice people, who want to make a difference. We believe that food touches every aspect of our lives so we value sustainable farming practices, sourcing local, treating animals humanely, and reducing food waste. As a certified B Corporation since 2013, we are committed to responsible business practices that are socially responsible.  If our values resonate with you, and you want to learn, grow and develop within a team that inspires, shares knowledge, and cares, then please apply! We are growing, innovating, and it’s our great people that make it fun to come to work every day.  is looking for a full-time, permanent This position is based out of our head office (105 5566 Trapp Avenue).

Title: Analyste d'affaire senior / Senior Business Analyst (IT)
Description: Êtes-vous ressourceur? Veolia aide ses clients à améliorer leur rendement énergétique, à mieux gérer leur édifices, leur eaux, leur eaux usées et à transformer leur déchets en ressources. Nous le faisons en trouvant des solutions sécuritaires, rentables et innovantes que nous apportons à nos multiples clients (entreprises, garages, hôpitaux, municipalités, etc). Ces derniers font de nous LA référence mondiale en environnement.    Pour participer pleinement à l'économie circulaire canadienne, nous pouvons compter sur plus de 1500 employés comme vous.    L'analyste d'affaires sénior travaille au sein des opérations pour transformer les besoins de l'entreprise en solutions, que ces solutions débouchent sur des configurations de produits, des développements de produits, des formations ou des recommandations de processus. L’analyste d'affaires sénior travaillent sur des projets vis-à-vis de nouveaux besoins ainsi que sur des opérations pour identifier et améliorer les processus et systèmes actuels.                    L'utilisation du masculin dans le présent document a pour seul but d'alléger le texte.

Title: Business Analyst IT
Description: Are you a Resourcer?  As an essential services provider, Veolia helps its customers to improve their energy efficiency, better manage their buildings, their water and wastewater and transform their waste into resources. As Resourcers, we do this 24/7/365 by finding safe, cost-effective and innovative solutions that we provide to our many clients (companies, garages, hospitals, municipalities, etc.). These make us THE global reference in the environment.    Currently, we are recruiting our next resourcer whose role will be  To fully participate in Canada's circular economy, we can count on more than 1500 employees like you.    The works within teams to transform business needs into solutions, whether these solutions result in product configurations, product developments, training or process recommendations. Business analysts work on projects for new needs as well as operations to identify and improve current processes and systems.

Title: BI Engineer
Description: Description  Are you interested in building and operating data reporting and analytical solutions for a greenfield product development effort centered on AWS technologies? Global Learning and Development (GLD) is hiring a BI Engineer (BIE) to build the Business Intelligence technology platform for our to-be-internally built learning platform of the future, and features within (end-to-end). GLD is responsible for the learning infrastructure at Amazon, comprised of both vendor and in-house tech. You will be a technical leader in the existing GLD development team, build, and drive the BI engineering needed for our product development. Our goal is to disrupt the current state of learning and development across Amazon and the world by using machine learning to bring together personalized learning and growth paths that extend beyond what occurs in a Learning Management System (LMS).  The successful candidate will be an expert with SQL, ETL (and general data wrangling), and have exemplary communication skills. The candidate will need to be comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and able to think big while paying careful attention to detail. The candidate will know and love working with business intelligence tools, can model multidimensional datasets, and can partner with customers to answer key business questions.          - AMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC Job ID: A1343484

Title: Expert ou experte Gouvernance et qualité des données
Description: Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise - et l'Amérique du Nord. Faites partie de notre équipe Information & Technologie (I&T), une pièce essentielle du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l'architecture d'entreprise à la technologie d'exploitation, nos équipes utilisent la méthodologie agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer, ce qui garantit que nos opérations se déroulent de manière optimale et sûre et que nos employés peuvent se concentrer sur des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez développer vos compétences et votre carrière dans notre culture étroitement liée et axée sur la sécurité en travaillant ensemble au sein d'UNE SEULE ÉQUIPE. Les carrières que nous proposons sont intéressantes car le travail que nous faisons est important. Rejoignez-nous !      La gouvernance des données au CN a pour but de s’assurer, au moyen de la définition des données ainsi qu’au moyen des politiques, des normes, des règles, des rôles et des responsabilités en matière de données, que l'information est gérée comme un actif stratégique, de la même manière que notre matériel ferroviaire.  Par conséquent, la personne titulaire de ce poste doit assurer la mise en œuvre de la gouvernance et de la qualité des données au CN dans le contexte d’un projet ou d’un soutien accordé à un secteur d’activité; elle doit mobiliser les intervenants parmi les cadres supérieurs pour faciliter et favoriser la collaboration au sein des secteurs d’activité.    L’expert ou l’experte Gouvernance et qualité des données travaillera de concert avec les deux disciplines et utilisera les meilleurs outils offerts sur le marché pour soutenir l’établissement d’un cadre relatif à la gouvernance et à la qualité des données de l’entreprise.    Les exigences pour chaque discipline sont les suivantes :                       Baccalauréat en informatique, en systèmes d’information ou dans un domaine connexe (p. ex., gestion de l’information) ou expérience équivalente de projets connexes           La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.

Title: Senior Business Analyst (B2B)
Description: At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!    The Specialist Business Analysis is responsible for identifying, eliciting, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of users throughout CN and for specific projects or initiatives. The Specialist acts as a liaison between the I&T groups (architecture, design, delivery, quality assurance, project management) and the business and translates needs into detailed stakeholder requirements/user stories, which the Specialist will follow through the project life cycle.      The Specialist may be required to travel occasionally in North America.          CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.  CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Overview  Intuit's Customer Success team within the Consumer Group is transforming the industry with a suite of high-touch professional services powered by data-driven, technology-lead operations and a distributed professional workforce.We are seeking an experienced and collaborative Sr. Business Systems Analyst to help define and drive implementing new tool capabilities and transform customer success into a world class, service-centric organization that is never satisfied losing a customer.  In this Sr. Business Systems Analyst role, you’ll partner with business owners and cross functional teams to launch intelligent inbound and outbound customer contact capabilities to enable experts to deliver targeted personalized service recovery and win-back programs using disruptive offers to retain and reacquire at-risk customers.

Title: Business Systems Analyst (Contract)
Description: The Source is Canada’s largest tech retailer, and every day we come into work excited to share cool tech and amazing brands with our fellow Canadians. From your local shopping centre to cool music festivals, we are where Canadians live, work and play.  Every day our Associates across the country help Canadians find the tech they want and need. The Source is a great place to work and we are committed to your development through best in class training programs that help you do your best. Behind our in-store Associates is a supporting team of professionals who curate our product assortment, ensure on-time deliveries, create engaging marketing campaigns and help keep our systems running at peak capacity.  We are passionate about what we do and look for individuals with their own passion, curiosity and genuine helpfulness to join us!  The career you want.  As the , the successful incumbent will elicit, validate, analyze, and document requirements for Retail I.T. projects. This includes translating those requirements into processes and technical solution deliveries; as well as business UAT leadership and hands-on testing. This role requires strong communication and business analysis skills as well as a burning desire to get the details right.    Skills we’re looking for.   #corp  Contractor Business Systems Analyst (Contract) Canada : Ontario : Barrie || Canada : Ontario : Toronto 11/27/2020  As Canada's favourite tech retailer you have the opportunity to work close to home - and we're also proud to offer a competitive compensation package that includes an extensive recognition and rewards program, career development opportunities, multi-faceted training programs, competitive medical and dental benefits, charity and volunteer opportunities and of course, associate discounts!  The Source celebrates and embraces diversity as part of our culture. We strive to be an inclusive, equitable and accessible environment that supports both our internal and external customers, ensuring everyone feels valued and respected. Accommodations are available on request for all candidates taking part in any aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or inclusion@thesource.ca to make arrangements.

Title: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  Client: Enterprise Technology  Contract: 7 months  Toronto/ remote

Title: Technical Business Analyst (contract)
Description: General  Job description:  This role will be responsible for gathering and documenting detailed business requirements so that our client can develop and enhance businesses applications and processes. Our client is looking for a highly motivated, customer service focused, organized resource to work as a Business Analyst to elicit and document requirements for large technical development projects. This person will be working closely with business partners, project managers, and technical resources to deliver in-depth requirements on the design and build of key initiatives within the company.          Job #45636

Title: Duck Creek Business Analyst
Description: Accenture Consulting: Your Unique Place in our Global Collective  Being part of Accenture Consulting means becoming an expert at making the New happen Now. To us, the New is all about the wise pivot that turns constant disruption to continuous reinvention. We are an innovation led company that works at the heart of our clients’ organizations so that no matter how complex the business challenge, we face the future with confidence.  If you love solving challenges and not just studying them, then Accenture Consulting is the right place for you. Join us to develop your ideas into provocative points of view and transformative insights that help shape industries. You’ll work with an amazing and diverse mix of world-class experts with access to one of the most robust portfolios of capabilities and ecosystem relationships in the industry. Together, you’ll do so much more than consult.  Coming here means future-proofing your career and going as far as your ambition takes you. Becoming a tech-savvy, well-rounded, multi-disciplined and market-relevant advisor doesn’t happen by chance. We invest in training and development in a big way, so you can build your future along with ours, creating an impactful career unique to you. Ultimately, we believe we is greater than me and that diverse perspectives lead to the best solutions. Joining Accenture Consulting means you will learn, innovate and lead, and together we will improve the way the world works and lives.    The Duck Creek Billing Analyst will work with the client’s Billing Product owners to elicit, rationalize and document user stories requirements for the Duck Creek Billing module. Help define high level Billing requirements as it relates to product model, forms, business rules, roles and permission, reporting, integrations and data. Facilitate requirement discovery sessions and provide billing insight and guidance to client. Transfer business requirement (EPIC/Features) to Story Cards with sizing. Clearly document assumptions, considerations, risk issues and execute follow ups. Must have strong Billing administration experience preferably Duck Creek and overall insurance industry experience with emphasis on P&C.  Additional responsibilities include:                                                         Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
