Title: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst     J.D. Irving, Limited - Sawmills Division is currently seeking a motivated individual for the role of Business Analyst, location in Saint John, New Brunswick. In this role, you will be working as part of an energetic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about achieving results.    Why Choose this Opportunity: - Competitive pay, comprehensive benefits plan, RRSP contributions - The opportunity to work with the best equipment and technology in the industry - Multiple career development opportunities - Various technical and Leadership training courses to ensure your success and continued development Roles & Responsibilities: - Provide business unit management with interpretive and predictive financial analysis to make business performance assessments - Responsible for analyzing and monitoring financial statements and other reports for conformance to budget, variance analysis, and developing recommendations for adjustments and improvements - Analysis and interpretation of trends requiring management’s attention - Develop, maintain, and provide financial information, plans, and projections to management - Investigate and prepare proposals for pricing and reimbursement strategies for current and future products across all relevant customer and market segments - Presentation of findings and specific recommendations by business unit management - Preparation and support for:- Strategic planning - Budgeting and budget analysis - Forecasting  - KPI and scorecard measure development - Analytical support for complex budget and capital projects. - Responsible for financial research and analysis related to the budget/strategic planning. - Conduct and document mid-level complexity financial analysis projects   Qualifications:   - Education Required: Bachelor’s Degree in Business  - CPA designation completed or in last steps of completion  - 2-5 years of experience in a financial analysis role  - Excellent communication skills  - Able to work as part of a team and independently  - Ability to lead change  The Company:    Founded in 1882, J.D. Irving, Limited (JDI) has operations in Eastern Canada (New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Quebec, Ontario, Newfoundland and Labrador), and the United States. We are a team of 16,000 dedicated employees.   At J.D. Irving, Limited, you are part of an energetic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about achieving results. With a culture that nurtures talent and creates an inclusive workplace, you can grow your career across our diverse operating divisions.    To Apply for this Career Opportunity:   Please apply online.   We appreciate your interest in our company however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.     To learn more about our products and services, click here.           J.D. Title: Digital Media Analyst
Description: Background  Agility PR Solutions provides powerful yet intuitive media outreach, monitoring, and measurement solutions for tomorrow’s communicators. Since 2003, clients have trusted our tools and services to help them discover and connect with journalists, amplify the impact of their messages, monitor media coverage, and measure the impact of their public relations efforts. Our patented monitoring technology and team of media analysts help organizations glean the insights that help them to flourish.  We have staff around the globe including the United States, the Philippines, offices in the United Kingdom, and Headquarters in the beautiful Canadian capital city of Ottawa.    Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics & Media Intelligence, the plays a significant role in preparing media analysis reports, including gathering requirements, conceptualizing, implementing, and delivering the final product. The Analyst’s tasks include: monitoring media from various sources (i.e. print, online, broadcast, social media, etc.) using proprietary software; judging the relevance of the content in the context of client business and directives; being able to connect the social and traditional metrics to overall company goals.  This role requires collaboration with a variety of departments and team members, both locally and overseas. The Media Analyst will help ensure a high standard of quality and productivity by training overseas team members on specific tasks and reviewing their work.  The successful candidate must be flexible, with an aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis, strong writing and editing skills, and in-depth knowledge of web analytics, social media platforms and analytics and media measurement. We are looking for someone with a strong eye for detail, strong organizational and time management abilities, and a passion for news and social media. This full-time position would be ideal for a well-rounded and experienced candidate who enjoys using words and visuals to tell the story behind the numbers.     Application deadline: Wednesday, November 25

Title: Analyste d'affaires et de marchés sénior / Sr. Market Business Analyst
Description: Rejoignez notre équipe et découvrez Audiokinetic!  Audiokinetic est le principal fournisseur mondial de solutions audio multiplateformes pour les industries des médias interactifs et des jeux. Les solutions middleware de la société, y compris les solutions primées Wwise® et SoundSeed®, offrent aux concepteurs sonores et aux programmeurs audio un outil de création complet et économique et un moteur audio pour créer des expériences interactives innovantes.    Relevant du CEO, vous agirez en tant qu'expert en matière d'études de marché et d'analyse de données, et serez une force motrice derrière notre stratégie de croissance du marché, en fournissant des informations pour guider la planification stratégique à long et à court terme.  En accord avec les priorités de l'entreprise, vous établirez et piloterez toutes les initiatives liées à l'intelligence d'affaires et aiderez chaque département à assurer une organisation axée sur les données.                Audiokinetic is the leading global provider of cross-platform audio solutions for the interactive media and gaming industries. The company’s middleware solutions, including the award-winning Wwise® and SoundSeed®, empower sound designers and audio programmers with a cost effective, comprehensive authoring tool and audio engine for creating innovative interactive experiences.    Reporting to the CEO, you will act as the key subject-matter expert on market research and data analysis, and will be a driving force behind our market growth strategy, providing insight to help guide long-term and short-term strategic planning.  In alignment with business priorities, you will establish and drive all initiatives related to business intelligence, and support every department towards ensuring a data-driven organization.

Title: Implementation Specialist / Business Analyst
Description: CityView has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst within our Professional Services department. In your role as Business Analyst you will be a primary agent of change, taking customers from paper-based and legacy systems into our modern CityView software and providing them with the means to serve their communities and help them grow.  CityView solves real-world business problems that local governments face in serving their constituents expeditiously. It does this by streamlining the complex business processes of permit, license and land management applications and approvals by providing constituents with online self-service and government employees with software that creates efficiencies of workflow management. We seek those with long-term career goals, because we believe in sustaining our growth and profitability long-term. We also seek people who are not afraid of change and who can endure the brisk pace set by our rate of growth and evolution. Reporting to the Director of Professional Services the successful Business Analyst will work closely with customers to collect business requirements, configure the software and deliver training for our CityView product.                   At CityView ( http://www.municipalsoftware.com ) the work is not mundane, the learning never stops and you will be provided with both personal and professional growth, travel, and a chance to learn about yourself and what you are capable of. In exchange for consistent performance, you will have the benefit of working largely autonomously and with reasonable flexibility to accommodate personal demands into your work life. You get to live in beautiful Victoria, which is a dream destination for many. The office is in a setting surrounded by green space and is a convenient commute with parking always available and reasonably priced. This is an opportunity to begin a long-term vocation with career prospects that go beyond CityView to Harris Computer Systems and further to the ultimate parent, Constellation Software. Constellation Software is publicly traded, owning over 400 vertical market software companies across the globe and is the largest software company in Canada. Seize the opportunity!    If you want to apply to this Business Analyst position (R0009492), visit our Harris Careers page . If this role does not align with your career goals, feel free to review all our current opportunities here or submit your resume to our Harris Talent Network here for future opportunities.

Title: Clinical Trials Data Analyst
Description: THIS IS A ONE YEAR TERM POSITION - MATERNITY LEAVE COVERAGE  Our Professional Services team is growing. We’re hiring Clinical Trials Data Anonymization Analysts to support an expanding line of business. In this role you’ll be end-to-end responsible for anonymization projects of client documents. Using our tools you will analyze and mitigate the risk of re-identification for trial participants whose data appears in clinical trials documentation. As an ideal candidate you learn quickly and can produce extremely accurate, precise work within tight timelines. You’re familiar with medical / healthcare language, comfortable with numbers, and your excellent communication skills are complemented by strong technical acumen and the ability to meet tight deadlines.                Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.  Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Title: Business Analyst and Administrator, Case & Data Management, Professional Regulation - Toronto
Description: Overview  JOB PURPOSE:  The Business Analyst & Administrator is responsible for providing complex requirements gathering and analysis for new and ongoing case management solution and other technology projects in the Professional Regulation Division (“PRD”), in particular, in relation to PRD’s case management system, the Integrated Regulatory Information System (“IRIS”). This includes having an in-depth understanding of the workflow and business processes followed by all departments in PRD; providing leadership to PRD regarding business process analysis, redesign and optimization; formulation of recommendations regarding feasibility, acquisition and/or development of business systems; consultation and implementation of system changes and new applications solutions; and overseeing technology training requirements. The Business Analyst & Administrator facilitates project execution, manages competing priorities and applies a high degree of professionalism in managing stakeholders and their expectations.                             The requirement to maintain a high standard of commitment, ethics, respect, care in service delivery to clients (internal and/or external).    The requirement to structure and deliver effective verbal and written communication with clients, staff, licensees, the public, and others in a non-threatening and constructive way.    The requirement to share responsibility for the achievement of team goals and the associated behaviours required for individuals to contribute effectively in a team environment.    The requirement to demonstrate an attitude that consistently strives to improve a standard of excellence for one’s self and for the benefit of the organization, its licensees and stakeholders.    The requirement to identify and analyze problems, determine root causes, evaluate alternative solutions and take and/or recommend appropriate solutions.    The requirement to apply knowledge and skills to carry out the work and/or provide advice. This also includes the quality of advice given, as well as the requirement to make decisions in the best interests of the organization as a whole.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description: IT Business Analyst (12 month contract) Location: Remote/Victoria, BC Staffing Placement Opportunity  The Consultant(s) will be assigned to one of the following projects and possibly others on an as needed basis:  Project 1will develop an information management framework capable of supporting modernized passenger transportation policies, regulations and legislation. Transformation of the existing systems to support these changes provides an opportunity to streamline current processes, improve interactions and data exchange between stakeholders, and improve service delivery. This project is currently implementing a solution using an agile methodology.  Project 2 will implement a new Internet of Things (IoT) platform that will collect camera and sensor data from different program area and make it easy to manage and share sensor information. The platform will enable new transportation solutions to be built. This project is currently in procurement and is anticipated to be entering the Implementation Phase when the assigned Consultant begins work. The role is to be performed remotely and onsite as required by the client.

Title: Senior Media Analyst - Ottawa
Description: Background  Agility PR Solutions provides powerful yet intuitive media outreach, monitoring, and measurement solutions for tomorrow’s communicators. Since 2003, clients have trusted our tools and services to help them discover and connect with journalists, amplify the impact of their messages, monitor media coverage, and measure the impact of their public relations efforts. Our patented monitoring technology and team of media analysts help organizations glean the insights that help them to flourish.  We have staff around the globe including the United States, the Philippines, offices in the United Kingdom, and Headquarters in the beautiful Canadian capital city of Ottawa.    Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics & Media Intelligence, the plays a significant role in preparing media analysis reports, including gathering requirements, conceptualizing, implementing, and delivering the final product. The Senior Media Analyst’s tasks include: monitoring media from various sources (print, online, broadcast, social, etc.) using proprietary software; judging the relevance of the content in the context of client business and directives; being able to connect the social and traditional media metrics to overall company goals.  This role requires collaboration with a variety of departments and team members, both locally and overseas. The Senior Analyst will help ensure a high standard of quality by reviewing work from other team members, project managing from report conceptualization to delivery of product that is executive-ready standard, and offering feedback and guidance to help elevate other team members.  The successful candidate must be flexible, with an aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis, strong writing and editing skills, data visualization smarts, and an in‐depth knowledge of web analytics, social media analytics, and media measurement. We are looking for someone with a strong eye for detail, strong organizational and time management abilities, and a passion for news and social media. This full‐time position would be ideal for a well‐rounded and experienced candidate who loves digging into data and using words and visuals to tell the story behind the numbers.       Application deadline: Wednesday, November 25

Title: Business Analyst
Description: Overview  SolarWinds MSP is an award-winning international software firm with a global reach. Our Best-in-Class products service thousands of business users with wide range of SaaS offerings to achieve our mission of empowering IT professionals to win through technology. At SolarWinds, we know it's our people that make us great.  We strive to improve the way we run our business on a daily basis. We value innovation and finding better ways to do work by constantly improving our processes and customer journey. Our employees are key to this work and we are not afraid to invest in your future with us through training and knowledge sharing.  We are looking for a self-driven individual to capture and document the re-evaluation of existing process and create documentation for new processes across multiple teams.

Title: Cúram Business Analyst - Ottawa - RedMane Technology
Description: Job Description  Cúram Business Analyst  Company Description  RedMane Canada is an application software consulting and systems integration company in Vancouver. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the Canada and the United States by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems. In particular, we are focused to helping Indigenous communities across Canada use technology to transform how they support their most vulnerable citizens.  RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.  We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.  The Role  RedMane has full-time and contract based opportunities for Cúram Business Analysts as we continue to grow our Canadian practice. As a Business Analyst you will provide system analysis, development and production support as part of a large Cúram implementation project. The Cúram Business Analyst will design functional approaches to customize functionality using the IBM Cúram Business Application Suite. The Business Analyst is also a lead team member in the planning and execution of testing, training, support of user testing and customer support post implementation.      All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:  Travel Requirements  The position offers the opportunity to travel, averaging from 35% to 55%. Project travel will vary throughout the project life cycle, being higher in the design and final testing and implementation phases. The position is based at our office in Chicago and our projects are located throughout the United States, and the Caribbean.  We Offer You  RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.  We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.    Curam

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.  We have over 48,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 8,000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.  The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects .      WSP is currently seeking for hands-on Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Business Intelligence and Data Integration team. Reporting to the Business Intelligence Lead the BI Analyst will be responsible to determine business needs, to create and support Power BI dashboards, reports, datasets and dataflows; to develop and maintain BI solutions to deliver high quality data to our users; to export data in various formats for internal and external purposes. The position is located in Quebec (Montreal) or Ontario (Thornhill).      Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).  WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.  WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY .  WSP Canada Inc.  Montréal, QC

Title: R&D Business Analyst / Analyste d’Affaire R et D
Description: We’re growing and our R&D department is looking for a creative and talented Business Analyst to join the team .  You are our ideal candidate if you have strong analytical skills, great abilities to develop solid relationships with business and technical stakeholders as well as the ability to balance business requirements with technical feasibility and sustainability. But first, a little about us....  Who are we?  Tecsys is a team of 500+ plus dynamic individuals who care about a job well done. We set ourselves apart in our commitment to the health industry by helping to develop and optimize pertinent logistics methods. Our people work in a test-driven environment where we spare no effort to deliver quality, reliability and performance. We’re also a growing company attuned to new trends and practices. All that's missing is you.  Your responsibilities  In this position, you will partner with seasoned business analysts as well as development teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient Elite Series logistics and warehousing solutions . You will ensure a clearly defined data and API strategy is in place. You will gather review, validate and document business and functional requirements. You will assist development and deployment teams in the end-to-end business process testing. You will work closely with the different stakeholders to ensure our strategy is well understood and is grounded with our clients reality.  Are you up for the challenge?       What else could give you an edge when applying?      Could this be the life-changing, skill and career building opportunity you've been waiting for? Don't be left wondering about what could have been. This is a growth-oriented position in an elite organization that respects and values key contributors. Act now and submit your resume.    Nous sommes en pleine croissance, et notre service de R&D cherche d’un An a lyste d’Affaire créatif et talentueux pour notre équipe .  Vous êtes un candidat idéal pour nous si vous avez de fortes aptitudes analytiques, une grande habileté à établir de solides relations avec des intervenants commerciaux et techniques ainsi que la capacité à équilibrer la faisabilité et la viabilité techniques. Mais avant, présentons-nous....  À propos de nous  Tecsys est une équipe de plus de +500 employés dynamiques qui ont le souci du travail bien fait. Tecsys se démarque par son engagement à l’égard du secteur de la santé, en contribuant à l’élaboration et à l’optimisation de méthodes logistiques pertinentes. Notre personnel travaille dans un environnement axé sur les mises à l’essai, où nous ne ménageons pas les efforts pour fournir des produits de qualité, fiables et rentables. Tecsys est également une entreprise en croissance qui s’adapte aux nouvelles tendances et pratiques. Il ne manque plus que vous.  Vos responsabilités  Dans le cadre de ce poste, vous travaillerez en partenariat avec des analystes d’affaires ainsi qu’avec des équipes de développement d’expérience pour mettre au point des solutions de logistique et d’entrepôt Elite Series dotées d’une grande évolutivité, souplesse et résilience. Vous vous assurerez qu’une stratégie API et des données clairement définies sont en place. Vous rassemblerez, examinerez, validerez et documenterez les exigences commerciales et fonctionnelles. Vous aiderez les équipes de développement et de déploiement dans le processus intégral d’analyse. Vous collaborerez étroitement avec différents intervenants pour garantir que notre stratégie est bien comprise et qu’elle correspond bien à la réalité de nos clients.  Êtes-vous prêt à relever le défi?       Qu’est-ce qui pourrait être un atout quand vous postulerez?  D’autres excellentes raisons de vous joindre à TECSYS  Serait-ce l’occasion tant attendue pour vous d’effectuer un changement majeur, de perfectionner vos compétences et de faire avancer vos possibilités de carrière? Ne soyez pas de ceux qui s’interrogeront sur ce qui aurait pu arriver. Cette offre d’emploi est axée sur la croissance au sein d’une entreprise d’élite qui respecte et valorise les contributeurs clés. Passez à l’action maintenant et soumettez votre CV.

Title: Lead Senior Analyst, Response & Recovery
Description: Opentext - The Information Company  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.     One of the key objectives of PMO, CLO is to manage our Company’s COVID-19 oversight program, which will include interacting with key business stakeholders, human resources, facilities, safety and security, and the broader legal and corporate development function.       We are looking for an individual who has strong cross-functional communication skills, excellent analytical and problem solving skills, with experience in crisis management or business continuity.  It is your job to help manage our pandemic response and recovery program through attaining and maintaining a thorough understanding of OpenText’s business operations and locations, working closely with stakeholders including our senior management, local site leadership, and local emergency response teams to support a safe and healthy work environment for our more than 60 physical locations around the world. You are positively excited about the opportunities to anticipate the challenges of uncertainty in a rapidly changing environment.  You’ll also interact with our business operations, Corporate Business Continuity team, HR, Facilities, Communications, and other cross-functional stakeholders.                At OpenText we understand and value diversity in our employees and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We hire the best talent regardless of race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, sex, age, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accommodationrequests@opentext.com. Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws including but not limited to: Family and Medical Leave Act (FLMA), Equal Employment Opportunity and Employee Polygraph Protection Act

Title: Senior Analyst, Contracts
Description: The Senior Analyst, Contracts will report to the Manager, Renewable Energy Contracts  General Accountabilities   The Senior Analyst, Contracts reports to the Supervisor, Renewable Energy Contracts who has primary responsibility for coordinating, managing and optimizing all IESO contract obligations relating to renewable energy contracts. The IESO has executed over 33,000 renewable energy contracts totaling over 6,000 MW. We thank all candidates for their interest in opportunities with the IESO. Be sure to follow us on .  The IESO is an equal opportunity employer. Title: Data Steward
Description: Company Description  Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization  When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $400 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to exceed $450 billion by 2025. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.  CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:  If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.    We are hiring a Reference Data Steward to join the enterprise Data Governance and Quality team. In this role, you will use your expertise across the data lifecycle to lead the development and execution of an enterprise data stewardship framework. Reporting to the Senior Product Manager of Data Governance, and in partnership with Investment Departments, Core Services, and other parts of Technology & Data, you will be responsible for reference data for Technology & Data and the business.       Consider applying if you have most of the following:   Additional Information  Visit our or on  At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.    CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Title: Business Analyst - Fenergo
Description: Project Description  Fenergo is a leading provider of Client Lifecycle Management, AML/KYC Compliance and Client Data Management solutions for investment, corporate, commercial and private banks. Excelian-Luxoft is looking for Fenergo experienced product consultants / business analysts to join our growing Fenergo practice and work on upcoming opportunities.  The Business Analyst will work with the client to gather and document system requirements, understand the client's business model and processes, and drive to resolve design issues with the client. The Product Consultant is required to support development efforts throughout the entire Software Delivery Lifecycle [SDLC], and participate in training, documentation, and knowledge transfer activities. This is a client-facing role, requiring the successful candidate to build strong relationships with the client and project teams and act as the first point of contact with the client's senior management and subject matter experts.

Title: Fenergo - Data Analyst(Technical)
Description: Project Description  Fenergo is a leading provider of Client Lifecycle Management, AML/KYC Compliance and Client Data Management solutions for investment, corporate, commercial and private banks. Excelian-Luxoft is looking for experienced product consultants / business analysts to join our growing Fenergo practice and work on upcoming opportunities.  The data analyst will work closely with the Product Consultant and the delivery manager. Product consultants are in charge of gather client requirements ie changes requested from teh proposed native functions of the Fenergo onboarding tool. Data analyst will be looking at designing, matching mapping client data from the client data referential(s) and systems to Fenergo systems and worklfow. The data analyst will ensure the migration of the client data to the correct system, structure and designated location.          Must have  Nice to have    English: C2 Proficient

Title: Senior Analyst, Accounting Operations
Description: With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 27,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.  CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.  We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!  Under general supervision, performs accounting activities in accordance with the organization's accounting policies, procedures and reporting requirements, reconciles accounts, posts journal entries and maintains accurate general ledger. Checks and analyzes financial information and prepares accounting statements and reports. Provides technical accounting advice and assistance to less experienced accounting staff      Bilingual: English - French (a plus)  Different qualifications or responsibilities may apply based on local legal and/or educational requirements. Refer to local job documentation where applicable.  #behring    Employee    Regular

Title: Financial Business Analyst - IT Assets depreciation
Description: Do you have strong analytical skills with the ability to create a dashboard that tells stories to key stakeholders? Have you delivered technology solutions that involved enterprise asset deployments? Then you could be Fivesky’s next Financial Business Analyst

Title: Associate IT Business Analyst
Description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.    Do you have a passion for analyzing, solving problems and quality? Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations. We are striving to create leading web and mobile experiences that enables our customers to choose how, when and where they want to engage with their financial services.  We are looking for a highly motivated that will analyze and implement product calculation engines that support a variety of Insurance products. You will work on a dynamic team to produce calculation engines for a suite of applications within an agile environment. If you have actuarial or mathematical skills and are open to work in a collaborative environment, we would like to talk to you.  In this position, you will be involved with the following:             Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.8 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.4 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Title: Analyste spécialisé(e) en informatique | Ingénieur de données massives
Description: Description  Faites une différence dans la vie des gens. Choisir le CIUSSS de l'Estrie - CHUS.  Toute une gamme d’avantages et de possibilités s’offrent à vous au CIUSSS de l’Estrie – CHUS :    Faites partie de l'équipe!    Personne qui assure la coordination, la gestion et la supervision des activités d'analyse, de mise en oeuvre, d'évolution, d'implantation, de support et de soutien opérationnel de projets concernant des systèmes d'information complexes, multisites, et touchant plusieurs secteurs de l'organisation.  Elle agit à titre d'expert dans son domaine de spécialisation. Elle coordonne le travail d'une équipe d'analystes et de techniciens en informatique pour la réalisation de ses mandats.  Plus précisément, les principales tâches et responsabilités :    Port d'attache : Hôpital Fleurimont situé au 3001, 12e Avenue Nord à Sherbrooke.      Pour faciliter votre intégration au CIUSSS de l'Estrie - CHUS, nous vous inviterons à une journée d'accueil et d'intégration. Vous bénéficierez aussi d'une période d'orientation dans le service qui vous accueillera.  Le CIUSSS de l'Estrie - CHUS applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité en emploi et invite les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités ethniques et visibles, et les personnes handicapées à soumettre leur candidature. Sur demande, des mesures d'adaptation peuvent être offertes aux personnes handicapées en fonction de leurs besoins.  Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui postulent mais devons les aviser que seules celles dont la candidature est retenue seront contactées.

Title: Sales Analyst
Description: At Hasbro, we are looking for people who want to explore, experiment, innovate and create. We’re changing the face of play and entertainment and looking for dreamers, doers, thinkers and creators to come up with the best ideas. Our culture of Community, Passion, Integrity, Creativity and Diversity & Inclusion has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative and highly committed individuals for 90+ years and we believe the best is yet to come.  Do you have a passion for analyzing data and providing insights that drive business decisions? In this role you will support the Sales team in achieving their objectives by providing analytics, making recommendations based on various sales activities related to their accounts and by actively overseeing POS and inventory levels!          Hasbro is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Financial Analyst, Corporate Development
Description: Overview  We are seeking a results-driven, entrepreneurial Financial Analyst, Corporate Development who is responsible for performing financial, valuation and business analysis to support the Company's business and corporate development initiatives. This position provides the strategic rationale and project planning support necessary to achieve alignment between market opportunities and the priorities guided by the leadership team and overall objectives of the Company. Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, the Financial Analyst works closely with key internal stakeholders across multiple business units, including members of the senior leadership team. This position will provide continuous professional development and corporate advancements within the Company. The successful candidate will work remotely based in Vancouver, BC.    To accelerate organizational growth through performance of complex financial analyses & modelling and strategic advisory.              Terramera is a cleantech leader focused on fusing AI, science and nature to create revolutionary technologies that transform how we grow food and solve other world-scale challenges. With its Actigate™ Targeted Performance technology and mission to unlock the intelligence in nature to ensure a world that thrives and provides for everyone, Terramera is committed to reducing global synthetic chemical loads in agriculture by 80 percent while increasing global farm productivity by 20 percent by 2030. The privately held company was founded in 2010 and has grown to include a world-class bench of engineers, scientists, advisors and investors. Terramera is headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, has integrated operations that include research labs, robotics workshop, greenhouse and farm, and has more than 200 patents in its IP portfolio.  Our success begins with our people. We're looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team.  Terramera offers a generous compensation package covering competitive base salary, unlimited paid vacation, options, bonus plan, extended health benefits, paid professional development activities, home office equipment, and other attractive elements.  While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com

Title: Senior Customer Solutions Manager, SaaS Managed Services
Description: Job Title: Senior Customer Solutions Manager, SaaS Managed Services Internal title: Senior Manager, CS, Support  The Who, What, Where and Why This is a new position at Aptean created to standardize support for SaaS Managed Services for multiple Aptean SaaS ERP products and expand the suite of corresponding services we provide. The individual in this role will be tasked with defining the SaaS Managed Service offerings, creating related roll out plans, interfacing with our Sales organization, and leading the technical team who will provide SaaS Managed Services going forward.

Title: Manager, Environmental, Social and Governance Consulting
Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada All Available Locations: Toronto Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office. Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.  Are you looking for an opportunity to help Canadian corporations drive their ESG strategies forward? Read more below!    Our established ESG practice thrives to grow, innovate, and offer quality and insights to our clients. We are looking for a technically strong, experience and motivated Manager, who wants to be part of this business that is constantly setting standards.  Our Managers work with our Partners, Directors and Senior Managers to lead the practice and deliver client engagement through managing diverse projects with multi-disciplinary and integrated teams, managing client and key stakeholder’s expectations and leading the development and presentation of materials to clients and the broader marketplace. They also lead business development and develop new service offerings and thought leadership initiatives.    Our Canadian practice brings people together through a truly National presence and has a diverse range of skills. You will work with people who have a broad range of skills and qualifications – accountants, engineers, scientists, management consultants and industry specialists. You will have the opportunity to work on strategy advisory, assurance and management system projects in a broad array of sectors including retail and consumer businesses, energy and resources, financial services and the public sectors. Some examples of our ESG services include: ESG/Responsible Investment strategy and policy development; ESG investment advisory; climate risk analysis and disclosure; carbon baseline development; portfolio target setting; carbon neutral strategy; and social performance improvement.    You are someone with:     Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:     Sound like  At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!  By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Title: Analyste principal de données
Description: Lightspeed recherche un(e) analyste de données senior à plein temps pour rejoindre notre équipe de données au sein du département Produits et Technologies. En analysant et en optimisant les données opérationnelles, tu pourras accélérer et améliorer notre aptitude à prendre des décisions en assurant que nous avons accès à des informations précises et opportunes. Si tu aimes creuser jusqu'à la racine des problèmes, trouver des schémas et travailler avec plusieurs équipes, ce rôle est fait pour toi.                   Lightspeed (TSX/NYSE: LSPD) fournit aux petites et moyennes entreprises ses plateformes de commerce omniprésentes basées sur le cloud dans plus de 100 pays à travers le monde. Grâce à ses systèmes de points de vente intelligents, évolutifs et fiables, Lightspeed offre des solutions tout-en-un qui aident les restaurants et les détaillants à vendre sur plusieurs canaux, à gérer leurs opérations, à établir un lien avec les consommateurs, à accepter des paiements et à faire croître leur entreprise.  Lightspeed, dont le siège social se trouve à Montréal, au Canada, bénéficie de la confiance des entreprises locales favorites, où la communauté va faire ses achats et déguster sa gastronomie. Lightspeed possède des bureaux au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Europe et en Australie.  Nous sommes passionnés par l'idée de permettre aux gens de faire leur meilleur travail. Venez travailler avec nous et découvrez ce que vous pouvez faire ! Title: Business Analyst
Description: First Derivatives (FD) is a software and services company with world-leading intellectual property in ultra-high-performance analytics (Kx) across industries, with extensive domain expertise and capabilities in capital markets systems and technology (managed services and consulting). FD provides a range of services worldwide to its clients in the capital markets sector, focused on supporting mission-critical systems as well as helping them to achieve and maintain regulatory compliance.

Title: Technical Business Analyst - Investment Management - $130,000 CAD + exceptional bonus + package!
Description: Technical Business Analyst required by my Investment Management client in Montreal.  Primary Responsibilities You will be responsible for gathering functional and technical requirements, dealing with internal and external parties (brokers and data providers), organizing functional and test specifications, and delivery of the product functionalities maintaining traceability to the agreed requirements. You will act as a bridge between investment, project management and other development teams.

Title: Research Analyst
Description: Position Summary At Explorer, the Analyst role is responsible for the collection, analysis, and visualization of data. As part of that role, they support the day to day management of numerous projects, working with internal and external stakeholders and suppliers. We are looking for individuals who will work on a team to support our clients and would report to a Research Manager or Director. Depending on your experience, the role could take the form of Data Analyst, Research Analyst, or Senior Research Analyst.

Title: Senior Analyst-financial research
Description: Senior Analyst Education: MBA/CA/CFA/ PGDM Experience: 4-6 years of experience in financial research  Job Description

Title: Manufacturing Process Mapping Business analyst
Description: Mandatrory Skills Bilingual in English and French Process Mapping Business analysis Atleast 10 years experience as a Business analyst / Functional consultant with Manufacturing experience Should have extensive experience working on process discovery and process documentation using different tools Should have participated in Business process reengineering activities Ability to communicate with various stakeholders ( Business / technical ) and create Process maps, functional and system specification documents  Outstanding communication, organizational, relationship-building , time management and collaboration skills Excellent attention to detail Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills

Title: Senior Analyst
Description: Challenge  It's in your nature to be the inquisitive type: always asking the questions everyone else is afraid to find the answers to. Luckily for our Toronto-based PE & VC client, you're not the type to shy away from asking the hard questions, finding the necessary clues, and getting your answers. As the Senior Analyst, you will be reporting directly to the Manager, Investment Finance, and become responsible for the accounting and reporting function, as well as providing transaction support and analytics. You will be working on an assigned portfolio, where you will ensure the completeness and accuracy of financial records for all investments: this is where your inquisitive nature comes into play. This role requires you to prepare and review quarterly/annual legal entity financial statements in accordance with appropriate accounting standards. You will use your 5+ years of relevant experience, especially with IFRS, private equity alongside other members within the Finance, Tax, and Legal and Deal teams. If you're the inquisitor with a mind for analysis and seeking answers, then apply today!    Financial Reporting & Analytics  Supports the Deal Team on various financial reporting and analytics for the Ventures and Growth Equity investment portfolios; Analyzes and provides performance return information (e.g. IRR, total return, etc) for the full portfolio and by segments, and prepares various management reports; Prepares/reviews quarterly and/or annual legal entity financial statements including notes and audit working papers in accordance with the appropriate accounting standards, as well as corresponding tax kits.  Fund Administration & Investor Reporting  Prepares quarterly and/or annual investor reporting in respect of internally managed venture capital funds, including applicable financial performance metrics. Respond to investor queries and requests as applicable.  Stakeholder Management & Oversight of Junior team members  Collaboration with many different departments and key stakeholders including; Deals team, portfolio companies, reporting, etc. You will also be responsible for managing a rotating co-op student program.

Title: Intern, Digital Data Analyst (Summer 2021) - Location Flexible
Description: Company Description Dropbox is now a Virtual First company, which means work outside of an office will be the primary experience for all employees. Being Virtual First also means the location of our employees is targeted but flexible. If “Location Flexible” is listed in the job title of a role, the role can be located in any of the states where Dropbox is authorized to do business.** Some roles (including those which do not have “Location Flexible” in the job title), however, may have to be co-located with their teams in certain locations. Please work with your recruiter and your hiring manager to understand any location constraints of a particular role and to communicate your location preferences.  **Dropbox is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Dropbox is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. Please speak with your recruiter to learn more about where Dropbox is registered.   Dropbox is one place to keep life organized and keep work moving. With more than 600 million registered users across 180 countries, we’re on a mission to design a more enlightened way of working. Dropbox is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, and has offices around the world. For more information on our mission and products, visit dropbox.com.

Are you a critical thinker who can help solve ambiguous problems facing infrastructure powering 600M+users?  Are you equally at home explaining your analyses and project recommendations with executives as you would be discussing the technical merits of your solution with wider audiences? If so, you’d be a great fit for our capacity planning role in infrastructure!  In this role, you will be responsible for designing and building data models using both in- house and third party software which help forecast and segment demand. You will work directly with service owners and product managers including senior leadership to understand their focus areas and provide insightful analyses while building scalable reporting processes for their capacity needs. You should be comfortable setting up data pipelines and perform ETL tasks necessary for data analysis.   You should be comfortable driving massive projects which span many teams, have a strong interest in doing the right thing for our users, and always think critically and strategically about infrastructure impact to Dropbox

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description: "This role is currently work-from-home and will move to the office environment after the COVID-19 restrictions are lifted.  We are looking for a candidate with 5-8 years of experience involving reporting/processing/transformation of Data    " Strong database fundamentals and experience on databases like Greenplum, Teradata, Netezza, Oracle etc " Strong Data Analysis and Reporting skills " Experience with Reporting tools like Tableau/Power BI/Cognos/BOXI etc " Data processing and Distributed Computing (Apache Spark, Hadoop, MapReduce) or Informatica/Datastage ETL processing " Python/Perl scripting experience   " Java 8 (Core Java Skills, Multi-threading, Database querying , Spring ) " Database performance tuning experience " Data modelling experience

Title: Data Analyst

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Company Description  As one of the largest independent technology companies in Atlantic Canada, Mariner has a team of over 200 IT, Software Professionals and Management Consultants working with clients both regionally and across the globe. With extensive capabilities in the areas of analytics, automation software, information security, change management and IT consulting, Mariner has been delivering innovative solutions with a strong emphasis on productivity and customer experience since 2003.    To help in our planned growth, we are pro-actively recruiting for Business Analysts for upcoming full-time and contract opportunities for our clients in Nova Scotia. The Senior Business Analyst will be a key member of our IT Professional Services team. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers.   Qualifications Additional Information  We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work - our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here, and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation, benefits packages and training and development. We are proud to have been recognized by Progress magazine as one of Atlantic Canada's TOP 101 companies, ranking #46 on 2015's list, up from #62 in 2014. We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the world's largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations. We are looking for passionate IT Business Analyst professionals who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers.  I'm interested

Title: Intermediate Database Analyst
Description: PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. We believe work is much more meaningful when you're doing it with a higher purpose. For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn .    To ensure a successful “no hassle” implementation of client’s data migration with a focus on data quality and integrity of core configuration setup and data conversion. Work directly with Project Management and Clients as a consultant on database related issues. Provide Support to other departments with production and non-production database related tasks. Work with other Technical Services team members to enhance and/or optimize current processes.      It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. Title: Shopper Insights Analyst
Description: Pets are our passion, safety is our promise and progress is our pledge. We work smarter, not harder. As a result, we’re widely known as a ‘Best Place to Work’. We make some of the world's most popular and trusted food brands and are committed to advancing the science, health and food products for pets.    Business areas: Nestlé Purina PetCare Canada Job title: Shopper Insights Analyst Location: Mississauga, Ontario Department: Marketing Development Organization (MDO)    We are looking for a based at our Nestle Purina PetCare Canada location in Mississauga, Ontario reporting into the Senior Shopper Insights Manager. This position is responsible for analyzing statistical market and shopper data to identify business issues and opportunities, and provide recommendations and insight for the Sales, Marketing and Category Development teams.    As a Shopper Insights analyst, you will be accountable for managing Nielsen data and internal databases ensuring the integrity of the data. You will develop a loyalty data strategy to deliver insights to the organization from Customer Loyalty systems and develop a POS and Data strategy to build efficiency and effectiveness with our data across the organization. You will be responsible for leading the 3rd party information partnership and participate in the development and implementation of 4P Plans for the MDO team as well as the development and implementation of Integrated Commercial Business Planning (ICBP) for major accounts.      As the successful candidate, you will be a self-starter and have excellent interpersonal skills, strategic business skills and time management skills. You will have proven problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to gain insights and develop recommendations. You will have strong knowledge of multiple insights tools and processes, both qualitative and quantitative. You will need to be results focused, detail oriented and thrive in a fast-paced environment managing several complex priorities with strict deadlines. You are required to have exceptional communication and presentation skills including the ability to explain difficult concepts and insights in simple, applicable business terms and have the ability to influence your target business audience.    We have a friendly, supportive team with a coaching and mentoring environment. There are real opportunities for future development and progression – this really could be a move towards the exciting career you’ve always wanted.  Nestlé is 308,000 employees strong and are driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic international working environment with constant opportunities for development. Want to learn more? Visit us at .

Title: Business Analyst, e-Commerce
Description: Nestlé Purina PetCare Canada are a leader in the pet care industry, whose vision is to be the world’s most trusted Company in Enriching the Lives of Pets and the People Who Love Them. We are high performers who thrive among the best and offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where you can contribute to challenging, satisfying and meaningful work. We are committed to building a team that is committed to pets and their owners. Your Pet, Our Passion®    Business areas: Nestlé Purina PetCare Canada Job title: Business Analyst, e-Commerce Location: Mississauga, ON Job Grade: 15    We are looking for a based at our PetCare Division in Mississauga, Ontario reporting into the Director, e-Commerce. This position is responsible for supporting the day-to-day customer management of Purina’s e-Commerce business with key online retailers. This is a data driven and analytical role that utilizes the strong communication and investigative skills to recommend positive changes in the way we approach our business. The successful candidate will make fact-based recommendations to help the account team deliver success against our Key Performance Indicators and optimize the business.    As a , you will be responsible for all e-Comm sales and marketing-related reporting and analytics.      As the successful candidate, you will have excellent interpersonal skills coupled with experience working cross-functionally with many departments. You will need to be passionate, results focused, detail oriented and enjoy working in a highly analytical and numbers driven position. You will already have great analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with your ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment. You will have strong communication skills and expertise presenting to both small and large groups. You will also:  We have a friendly, supportive team with a coaching and mentoring environment. There are real opportunities for future development and progression – this really could be a move towards the exciting sales career you’ve always wanted.    What can we offer in return? Great benefits you’d expect from a business the size of Nestle including a comprehensive total rewards benefits package including Health and Dental benefits that start on day one as well as a Company matched retirement savings plan, Excellent training and development programs as well as opportunities to grow within the company.  The closing date for applications is . We will be considering applicants as they apply, so please don’t delay in submitting your application.  Nestlé is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform Human Resources of any accommodations you may require. Nestlé will work with you in an effort to ensure that you are able to fully participate in the process.

Title: Senior Media Analyst
Description: Background  Agility PR Solutions provides powerful yet intuitive media outreach, monitoring, and measurement solutions for tomorrow’s communicators. Since 2003, clients have trusted our tools and services to help them discover and connect with journalists, amplify the impact of their messages, monitor media coverage, and measure the impact of their public relations efforts. Our patented monitoring technology and team of media analysts help organizations glean the insights that help them to flourish.  We have staff around the globe including the United States, the Philippines, offices in the United Kingdom, and Headquarters in the beautiful Canadian capital city of Ottawa.    Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics & Media Intelligence, the plays a significant role in preparing media analysis reports, including gathering requirements, conceptualizing, implementing, and delivering the final product. The Senior Media Analyst’s tasks include: monitoring media from various sources (print, online, broadcast, social, etc.) using proprietary software; judging the relevance of the content in the context of client business and directives; being able to connect the social and traditional media metrics to overall company goals.  This role requires collaboration with a variety of departments and team members, both locally and overseas. The Senior Analyst will help ensure a high standard of quality by reviewing work from other team members, project managing from report conceptualization to delivery of product that is executive-ready standard, and offering feedback and guidance to help elevate other team members.  The successful candidate must be flexible, with an aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis, strong writing and editing skills, data visualization smarts, and an in‐depth knowledge of web analytics, social media analytics, and media measurement. We are looking for someone with a strong eye for detail, strong organizational and time management abilities, and a passion for news and social media. This full‐time position would be ideal for a well‐rounded and experienced candidate who loves digging into data and using words and visuals to tell the story behind the numbers.     Application deadline: Wednesday, November 25

Title: IT Senior Analyst - Process & Solutions - Finance
Description: About Us  At Saputo, we make contributions that matter every day. We’re a growing team of dedicated and passionate people around the world with a longstanding history of excellence. Each of our employees bring their best every day, and together we create the high-quality products our customers and consumers enjoy.    Ensuring the well-being of our employees is our priority. Title: Senior Business Analyst (Microsoft Dynamics AX)
Description: Senior Business Analyst (Microsoft Dynamics AX)  Acosys Consulting is actively seeking to hire a Senior Business Analyst (Microsoft Dynamics AX) to join our Health and Benefits Provider client.  The successful candidate will analyze the AX system processes and data in response to business initiatives to help drive higher productivity and streamlined activities and events. The analyst will be responsible for working closely with the Product Owner to support and analyze their business needs. The analyst must be effective at identifying areas of possible change, defining requirements, and work to improve the overall benefit of the AX system. The analyst must also be able to help the team trouble-shoot production incidents.             Acosys Consulting Services thanks all applicants. Please be advised that only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. If interested, please forward a copy of your resume to pravikumar@acosysconsulting.com

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description: This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.  The Lead Data Analyst for Future Insurance Platform Data Integration is the senior most member of the development team responsible for translating business requirements into pragmatic and functional application/technology solutions. The primary responsibility of this individual is to act as the steward of the FIP Data Dictionary, grow into the expert of data and functional data transformations across components of the solution (subject areas of customer, broker, submission, quote, policy transactions, billing, claims), lead the requirements, design, and implementation of data as it is passed to other corporate consumers, and drive the development team toward quality delivery. Strong knowledge of the insurance domain from a data perspective, experience in data dictionary maintenance / data lineage maintenance is required. Knowledge and expertise in Duck Creek Policy and Claims Manuscript/ Console configuration, XSLT transforms, SQL Business Intelligence/Database queries and stored procedures is preferred. Knowledge in Duck Creek Data Insights is a plus. A successful candidate will combine hands on functional/technical skills with the ability to develop solutions and mentor a technical delivery teams.

Description: Summary    System Quality Analyst, Medical Imaging– Treatment Session Management (TSM) is responsible for providing expertise in treatment session management, such as image processing and motion monitoring to the MR Business line and testing solutions software products throughout the last phase of the software development life cycle to prove that the system meets its design requirements and is both safe and effective, in addition to troubleshooting field issues.
